help.title: Help & Support
help.gettingStartedDesc: Learn the basics of AI Council

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.whatIsCouncilAnswer: An AI Council is 5 different AI models (like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) working together. Each one answers your question, they review each other's answers, and then the best insights are combined into one final response.
faq.howManyAIsAnswer: By default, 5 AI models answer your question in Stage 1. Then 3 models review and rank those answers in Stage 2. Finally, one model synthesizes the best answer in Stage 3.
faq.whatAreStagesAnswer: Stage 1 (Answers): Each AI gives their perspective. Stage 2 (Review): AIs vote on which answer is best. Stage 3 (Synthesis): The top insights are combined into one comprehensive answer.
faq.howLongTakesAnswer: A full council deliberation typically takes 30-60 seconds. Quick mode (1 AI) is faster at 5-10 seconds.
faq.whatIsDepartmentAnswer: Departments and roles help the AI understand your company. When you select 'Marketing' or 'CTO', the AI tailors its advice to that perspective.
faq.whatIsPlaybookAnswer: Playbooks are your company's guides - SOPs (how-to procedures), Frameworks (thinking models), and Policies (rules). The AI references these when giving advice.
faq.canITrustAI: Can I trust the AI's answers?
faq.canITrustAIAnswer: AI can make mistakes. Always verify important decisions. The council format helps by showing multiple perspectives and highlighting disagreements.
faq.whereDataStoredAnswer: Your data is stored securely in our cloud database. We don't train AI models on your conversations. You can delete your data anytime.

quickTips.title: Quick Tips
quickTips.tip1: Use ⌘K (or Ctrl+K) to quickly navigate anywhere
quickTips.tip2: Select departments to get role-specific advice

quickTips.tip4: Create projects to track related decisions

settings.title: Settings
settings.deleteAccountWarning: This action cannot be undone. All your data will be permanently deleted.
settings.bioPlaceholder: Tell us about yourself or your business...
settings.removeApiKeyConfirm: Remove your OpenRouter API key? You will use the system key with usage limits.
settings.aiProviderDescription: AxCouncil uses AI models to power the council. Connect your own API key to have full control over costs — you only pay for what you use, directly to the provider.
settings.openRouterTagline: Access all major AI models through one API
settings.whatIsOpenRouterDesc: OpenRouter is a service that gives you access to all the major AI models (like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and more) through a single account. Instead of signing up separately with OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, etc., you just need one OpenRouter account.
settings.openRouterAnalogy: Think of it like a phone plan that lets you call any network — OpenRouter lets you use any AI model without managing multiple subscriptions.
settings.billingExplainer: You only pay for what you use. There are no monthly fees or subscriptions. Each time the council runs, it costs a small amount (typically a few cents) which is charged directly to your OpenRouter account.
settings.billingNote: AxCouncil does not charge you for AI usage — all costs go directly to OpenRouter at their published rates. You can set spending limits on your OpenRouter account to stay in control.
settings.keySecurityNote: Yes. Your API key is encrypted before being stored and is only ever decrypted on our secure servers when making AI requests. We never log or expose your full key.
settings.howToGetKey: How to get your OpenRouter API key
settings.step1Desc: Go to openrouter.ai and sign up for a free account. You can use Google, GitHub, or email.
settings.step2Desc: Go to Credits and add funds. Start with $5-10 to try it out — this will last for many council sessions.
settings.step3Desc: Go to API Keys and click "Create API Key". Give it a name like "AxCouncil" and optionally set a spending limit.
settings.step4Title: Copy and paste your key below
settings.step4Desc: Your key will look like sk-or-v1-... — paste it in the field below and we'll verify it works.
settings.keyEncrypted: Your key is encrypted and stored securely
settings.usageDescription: Your council queries this billing period
settings.manageSubscriptionDesc: Update payment method, view invoices, or cancel
settings.userMustExist: User must have an existing account to be added.
settings.devWarning: Developer settings are for testing only. Changes affect your session.
settings.mockModeDesc: Use simulated AI responses instead of real API calls
settings.mockModeOn: Using simulated responses — no API costs
settings.mockModeOff: Using real API calls — credits will be consumed
settings.mockModeActive: Mock mode active. No tokens will be consumed during this session.
settings.promptCachingDesc: Cache prompts to reduce costs (Claude, GPT & DeepSeek)
settings.cachingOn: Caching ON — reduces costs by caching context
settings.tokenUsageDesc: Show detailed token counts per stage during council sessions
settings.tokenUsageOn: Showing tokens, cost estimates, and cache hits per stage
settings.tokenUsageInfo: Token usage will be displayed below each council stage.
settings.mockLengthOverrideDesc: Test different lengths without changing LLM Hub
settings.mockLengthOverrideActive: Override active: Mock will use {{tokens}} tokens regardless of LLM Hub settings

stages.creativityHint: Creativity controls how predictable or varied the AI's responses are. Lower values give consistent, focused answers. Higher values allow more originality and unexpected ideas.

explainers.temperature: How creative the AI should be. Lower = safer, higher = more varied.
explainers.tokens: Words the AI can write. 500 tokens ≈ 1 page of text.
explainers.maxTokens: Maximum response length. Longer answers cost more.
explainers.model: Which AI brain to use. Different models have different strengths.
explainers.preset: Pre-configured settings for common use cases.
explainers.fallback: Backup model if the primary one is unavailable.

conservative.label: Conservative
conservative.desc: Predictable, factual responses. Best for compliance, legal, and data analysis.

balanced.label: Balanced
balanced.desc: Our recommended default. Reliable yet flexible for everyday business tasks.

creative.label: Creative
creative.desc: More varied responses. Great for brainstorming, marketing, and content creation.
